name: euphorbia corollata
description: Flowering Spurge is sometimes is called native Baby's Breath because of its resemblance to that horticultural variety.  For about six weeks in mid- to late summer, plants are bowed by numerous blossoms, which have yellow centers ringed by five white petals with a touch of green near the center.  A toxic white latex in the leaves and stems keeps deer and other mammals away.
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
